intro: Passerina velutina f. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved velvetleaf, is a variant of the velvetleaf plant characterized by its reduced leaf size. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features ovate to lanceolate leaves that are velvety to the touch, with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. Its flowers are typically yellow or pale green, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. This form is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
